fields.Title of Presentation: “From Myth to Market: Consuming Mexican Feather Art”
fields.Conference/Meeting Name: Group for Early Modern Cultural Studies
fields.Description/Abstract: The feather, and especially the Mexican arte plumaria, was one of the many American objects to mediate the space between the New and Old Worlds, operating in a cross-cultural network of material exchange; not merely as an inanimate object of trade, but as an active agent, the Amerindian feather transformed European decorative arts and literature.
